content.raw:
I've been testing playback of `test/logs/insertion_deletion.log` on homebrew, and I'm getting some weird gzclient crashes when I try to select the inserted box, both with this branch and with the gazebo8 debs.

Also, with this branch, there's a ghost version of the inserted box that just stays at its initial location. I'm investigating this further and will see if I can reproduce on my Ubuntu machine.
content.html:
I've been testing playback of test/logs/insertion_deletion.log on homebrew, and I'm getting some weird gzclient crashes when I try to select the inserted box, both with this branch and with the gazebo8 debs.

Also, with this branch, there's a ghost version of the inserted box that just stays at its initial location. I'm investigating this further and will see if I can reproduce on my Ubuntu machine.

content.raw:
Commit 11c0c9b adds support for both cases, but I'm not a fan of it since when the `<sdf>` tag is missing, SDF prints misleading error messages when nothing wrong happened:

~~~
Error [parser_urdf.cc:3474] Unable to call parseURDF on robot model
Error [parser.cc:341] parse as old deprecated model file failed.
~~~

This is coming from the `sdf::readString` function. I'm not sure if this is the recommended way of checking whether an SDF string is valid or not. Also see [this](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issues/151/trying-to-parse-an-invalid-file-gives-urdf) SDFormat issue.

If there isn't a better way to check for valid SDF, I was thinking of just using TinyXML. Thoughts?
content.html:
Commit 11c0c9b adds support for both cases, but I'm not a fan of it since when the <sdf> tag is missing, SDF prints misleading error messages when nothing wrong happened:

Error [parser_urdf.cc:3474] Unable to call parseURDF on robot model
Error [parser.cc:341] parse as old deprecated model file failed.

This is coming from the sdf::readString function. I'm not sure if this is the recommended way of checking whether an SDF string is valid or not. Also see this SDFormat issue.

If there isn't a better way to check for valid SDF, I was thinking of just using TinyXML. Thoughts?

content.raw:
I ran into another issue which I'm looking into right now:

1. Start Gazebo not recording a log
1. Insert a double pendulum
1. Start recording log
1. Stop log, close Gazebo
1. Playback: there will be 2 pendulums, one doesn't move

This is happening because the pendulum is being included both on the world description and in an insert tag.
content.html:
I ran into another issue which I'm looking into right now:

  1. Start Gazebo not recording a log
  2. Insert a double pendulum
  3. Start recording log
  4. Stop log, close Gazebo
  5. Playback: there will be 2 pendulums, one doesn't move

This is happening because the pendulum is being included both on the world description and in an insert tag.

content.raw: There was a sneaky deadlock between the `TopicManager` and the `World`. If you're curious, here's the [backtrace](https://bitbucket.org/snippets/chapulina/Eb9rb). I think I fixed it by processing the log playback control messages in the physics thread: 5f5afea
content.html: There was a sneaky deadlock between the TopicManager and the World. If you're curious, here's the backtrace. I think I fixed it by processing the log playback control messages in the physics thread: 5f5afea
